_header: In whom is truth pity freedom and hardiness
Note: Variant on the epilogue to Chaucer’s ‘Gentilesse’ (5277), which appears in one MS.
_description: Qualities of a Gentleman — two couplets

BLSl775.Transcription:
In whom is trauthe pettee fredome and hardynesseHe is a man inheryte
                    to gentylmeneOff thisse virtues iiij who lakkyth iijHe aught never
                    gentylmane called to be
